sen.j: 廟（びょう、みたまや、おたまや、ほこら）
sen.e: Mausoleum (Byo, Mitamaya, Otamaya, Hokora)
Mausoleum (Byo, Mitamaya, Otamaya, Hokora)
Mausoleum (Byo, Mitamaya, Otamaya, Hokora)

sen.j: 死者の霊を祀る所。
sen.e: A place to perform memorial rites for the dead.
A place to perform memorial rites for the dead.
A place where memorial rites are performed for the dead.
sen.cmt: This reads a little more naturally, I think.

sen.j: もと祖先の霊を祀る所。
sen.e: It used to be a place to perform memorial rites in honor of ancestors.
It was once a place to perform memorial rites in honor of ancestors.
Mausoleums were once used to perform memorial rites in honor of one's ancestors.
sen.cmt: As this sentence follows immediately after the one above, I have tried to make the transition between them more smooth.

sen.j: 現在は故人一般を祀るところに使う。
sen.e: Nowadays, it is used as a place to perform memorial rites in honor of the deceased in general.
Nowadays, it is used as a place to perform memorial rites in honor of the deceased in general.
Nowadays, they are used to perform memorial rites in honor of the deceased in general.
sen.cmt: As the subject of the preceding sentence is now plural, I had to change this to the third person plural.

sen.j: 別名、霊廟（れいびょう）。
sen.e: Also known as Reibyo (shrine).
Also known as Reibyo (shrine).
Mausoleums are also known as Reibyo (shrine).
sen.cmt: Again, all of this information is in one paragraph, so attempt must be made to make it flow.

sen.j: 本来墓とは全く異なるが、墓のことも廟と呼ばれることもある。
sen.e: It is completely different from a tomb in origin, but a tomb can also referred to as a mausoleum.
It's origin is completely different from that of a tomb, but a tomb can also referred to as a mausoleum.
While mausoleums are completely different from tombs in origin, a tomb can also be referred to as a mausoleum.
sen.cmt: As above. Also, the edited sentence (see the entry under the "trans 2" heading) introduced a grammatical mistake by saying "It's origin" (this should be "its origin") and left one grammatical mistake uncorrected ("be" is required between "also" and "referred").

sen.j: この項で記述。
sen.e: Explained under this category.
Explained under this category.
Explained under this category.

sen.j: 王宮の前殿で、政治を行う所。
sen.e: A front hall of a royal palace and a place to take the reins of government.
The front hall of a royal palace and a place to take the reins of government.
The front hall of a royal palace and a place to take the reins of government.

sen.j: 中国における廟
sen.e: Mausoleums in the People's Republic of China
Mausoleums in the People's Republic of China
Mausoleums in the People's Republic of China

sen.j: 中国において廟は、祖先の霊を祭る場であるが、墓所は別に存在する。
sen.e: In China, a mausoleum is a place to perform memorial rites in honor of ancestors, and tombs exist separately.
In China, a mausoleum is a place to perform memorial rites in honor of ancestors, so tombs exist separately.
In China, a mausoleum is a place to perform memorial rites in honor of ancestors, so tombs exist separately.

sen.j: その為、仏教における仏壇のような位置づけであるが、仏壇とは違い母屋の中には無く、霊廟専用の別棟があった。
sen.e: For this reason, its positioning is similar to a Buddhist altar in Buddhism, but unlike Buddhist alters, mausoleums were not placed in a main building but in a separate building dedicated for a mausoleum.

For this reason its positioning is similar to a Buddhist altar in Buddhism; however, unlike Buddhist alters, mausoleums were not placed in a main building but in a separate building dedicated for use as a mausoleum.

For this reason its positioning is similar to a Buddhist altar in Buddhism; however, unlike Buddhist alters, mausoleums were not placed in a main building but in a separate building dedicated for use as a mausoleum.

sen.j: 祖先を篤く敬う中国では、古代から家中で最も重要な場所とされていた。
sen.e: Since ancestors are highly respected in China, the mausoleum has been regarded as the most import part of the house since ancient times.
Because ancestors are highly respected in China, the mausoleum has been regarded as the most important part of the house since ancient times.
Because ancestors are highly respected in China, the mausoleum has been regarded as the most important part of the house since ancient times.

sen.j: また、孔子を祀る廟や関羽を祀る廟が各地に多数存在するように、祖先の霊だけではなく、民衆が敬愛する対象の廟を建立して祭っている事もある。
sen.e: Also, there are cases where mausoleums were erected not only to perform memorial rites in honor of ancestors but to the spirit of someone people admired, as seen in a numerous mausoleums sacred to the memory of Confucius or Guan Yu around the country.

Also, there are cases where mausoleums were erected not only to perform memorial rites in honor of ancestors but also to the spirit of someone people admired, as seen in numerous mausoleums sacred to the memory of Confucius or Guan Yu around the country.

Also, there are cases where mausoleums were erected not only to perform memorial rites in honor of ancestors but also to the spirit of someone people admired, as seen in numerous mausoleums sacred to the memory of Confucius or Guan Yu around the country.

sen.j: 日本における廟
sen.e: Mausoleums in Japan
Mausoleums in Japan
Mausoleums in Japan

sen.j: 神式
sen.e: Shinto rites
sen.cmt: プログレッシブ和英中辞典
sen.e: Shinto rites
Shinto rites

sen.j: 主に通常の神社と大差ない方式で祀られている。
sen.e: Mausoleums are dedicated to deities in quite a similar way to regular shrines.
Mausoleums are dedicated to deities in a very similar way to regular shrines.
Mausoleums are dedicated to deities in a very similar way to regular shrines.

sen.j: 延喜式神名帳に「大帯姫廟神社」(現宇佐神宮本社の一つ)とあるが、一方では神名帳にないが延喜式の式部寮の項に「橿日廟」(現香椎宮)とあり、神社と区別されている例もあったらしい。
sen.e: Even though "Otarashihime no byo jinja" (one of head shrines of Usa-jingu Shrine) in included in Jimmyocho (the list of deities) of Engishiki (codes and procedures on national rites and prayers). On the other hand, "Kashii-byo" (now Kashii-gu Shrine) is not included in Jimmyocho but included under the category of Shikiburyo of Engishiki, which indicates that there were cases where mausoleums were distinguished from shrines.

Even though "Otarashihime no byo jinja" (one of the head shrines of Usa-jingu Shrine) is included in "Jimmyocho (List of Deities)" in "Engishiki (Codes and Procedures on National Rites and Prayers); however, "Kashii-byo" (now Kashii-gu Shrine) is not included in Jimmyocho but included under the category of "Shikiburyo" in "Engishiki," which indicates that there were cases where mausoleums were distinguished from shrines.

Even though 'Otarashihime no byo jinja' (one of the head shrines of Usa-jingu Shrine) is included in Jimmyocho (List of Deities) in Engishiki (Codes and Procedures on National Rites and Prayers); however, 'Kashii-byo' (now Kashii-gu Shrine) is not included in Jimmyocho but included under the category of Shikiburyo in Engishiki, which indicates that there were cases where mausoleums were distinguished from shrines.
sen.cmt: 原文の「」に合わせ、"を'にしました。原文に「」のない部分は"を削除しました。

sen.j: 有名なものでは豊国神社 (京都市)や日光東照宮がある。
sen.e: Famous examples of mausoleums include Toyokuni-jinja Shrine/Hokoku-jinja Shrine (Kyoto Prefecture) and Nikko Toshogu Shrine.
Famous examples of mausoleums include Toyokuni-jinja Shrine/Hokoku-jinja Shrine (Kyoto Prefecture) and Nikko Toshogu Shrine.
Famous examples of mausoleums include Toyokuni-jinja Shrine/Hokoku-jinja Shrine (Kyoto Prefecture) and Nikko Toshogu Shrine.

sen.j: 江戸時代に創建された各藩の藩祖を祀る神社や明治以降に創建された別格官幣社などがある。
sen.e: There are shrines dedicated to the spirit of heads of han (domains) in Edo Period and Bekkaku-Kampeisha established after Meiji Period.
There are shrines dedicated to the spirits of the heads of han (domains) in the Edo period and the Bekkaku-Kampeisha, established after the Meiji period.
There are shrines dedicated to the spirits of the heads of han (domains) in the Edo period and the Bekkaku-Kampeisha, established after the Meiji period.

sen.j: また、戦死者などを祀る靖国神社、殉職警察官、消防士などを祀る弥生神社(現、弥生堂)、航空事故犠牲者を祀る飛行神社など、集合的に慰霊を目的として祀る例も多い。
sen.e: Also, there are many cases where mausoleums were built to console the souls of the deceased as a group, as seen in the examples of Yasukuni-jinja Shrine, Yayoi-jinja Shrine (now Yayoido) which is dedicated to policemen and firefighters who dies on duty, Hiko-jinja Shrine which is dedicated to the victims of airplane accidents, etc.

Also, there are many cases where mausoleums were built to console the souls of the deceased as a group, as seen in the examples of Yasukuni-jinja Shrine, Yayoi-jinja Shrine (now Yayoido) which is dedicated to policemen and firefighters who have died while on duty, Hiko-jinja Shrine, which is dedicated to the victims of airplane accidents, etc.

Also, there are many cases where mausoleums were built to console the souls of the deceased as groups, as seen in the examples of Yasukuni-jinja Shrine, which is dedicated to the war dead, Yayoi-jinja Shrine (now Yayoido) which is dedicated to policemen and firefighters who have died while on duty, and Hiko-jinja Shrine, which is dedicated to the victims of airplane accidents, etc.
sen.cmt: 「戦死者などを祀る」の訳を補いました。

sen.j: 上記の例を見ても分かるように、政治権力や政策と結びつくことも多い。
sen.e: As shown in the above examples, mausoleums are often connected with political powers or policies.
As shown in the above examples, mausoleums are often connected with political powers or policies.
As shown in the above examples, mausoleums are often connected with political powers or policies.

sen.j: 天満宮も菅原道真を祀るので廟には違いないが、天神としての神を祀っているという認識のが一般的である。
sen.e: Temmangu is indeed a mausoleum as it is dedicated to the memory of SUGAWARA no Michizane. However, Temmangu is commonly recognized as a shrine sacred to the god of Tenjin (the deified spirit of SUGAWARA no Michizane).
sen.cmt: 「のが」は「の方が」のタイポと思われます。
sen.e: Temmangu is indeed a mausoleum, since it is dedicated to the memory of SUGAWARA no Michizane; however, Temmangu is commonly recognized as a shrine sacred to the god of Tenjin (the deified spirit of SUGAWARA no Michizane).

Tenmangu is indeed a mausoleum, since it is dedicated to the memory of SUGAWARA no Michizane; however, Temmangu is commonly recognized as a shrine sacred to the god of Tenjin (the deified spirit of SUGAWARA no Michizane).

sen.j: 霊廟としての神社では、建築様式に権現造が用いられることが多い。
sen.e: The gongen-zukuri structure is often used for shrines built as mausoleums.
The gongen-zukuri structure is often used for shrines built as mausoleums.

A white-domed, marble mausoleum, it was built in the memory of the wife of Emperor Mughal Emperor.

sen.j: 大理石に宝石、貴石を散りばめた廟で、イスラム建築の至宝とも言われている。
sen.e: As a mausoleum set with gems and precious stones in marble, the Taj Mahal is also cited as the jewel of Islamic architecture.

sen.j: 欧米における廟
sen.e: Mausoleums in Western Countries

Mausoleums in Western Countries

sen.j: 欧米の霊廟、マウソレウム（Mausoleum）とは、亡くなった指導者のために構築される大きく印象的な墓を指している。
sen.e: Mausoleums in Western countries refer to large and impressive tombs constructed for a deceased leader.
The term "mausoleum" in Western countries refers to a large, impressive tomb constructed for a deceased leader.
The term "mausoleum" in Western countries refers to a large, impressive tomb constructed for a deceased leader.

sen.j: 後に亡くなった個々の人々の為の地下聖堂を含んでおり、近代のものは、従来の霊廟地下墓室に加え、納骨堂を持っている。
sen.e: Later, mausoleums encloses a burial chamber within a burial vault below the superstructure, and modern mausoleums have columbaria (a type of mausoleum for cremated remains) in addition to the former burial chambers under the mausoleums.

Later, mausoleums would enclose a burial chamber within a burial vault below the superstructure, but modern mausoleums have columbaria (a type of mausoleum for cremated remains) in addition to the former burial chambers under the mausoleums.

sen.j: 現在では教会のような大型施設の一部になっている事もある。
sen.e: Nowadays, mausoleums are sometimes included as a part of a larger facility such as a church.
Nowadays, mausoleums are sometimes included as a part of larger facilities such as churches.
Nowadays, mausoleums are sometimes included as a part of larger facilities such as churches.

sen.j: ロサンゼルスの聖マリア大聖堂は、埋葬のための6,000の陵と納骨堂のスペースを持っている。
sen.e: The Cathedral of Our Lady of the Angels Los Angeles in Log Angeles has 6,000 sepulchral and cinerary urn spaces for interments.
The Cathedral of Our Lady of the Angels, in Los Angeles, has 6,000 sepulchral and cinerary urn spaces for interments.
The Cathedral of Our Lady of the Angels, in Los Angeles, has 6,000 sepulchral and cinerary urn spaces for interments.

sen.j: 英名のマウソレウムは、カリア国を統治したアケメネス朝ペルシアの王、マウソロス（Maussollos）の霊廟が由来である。
sen.e: The English word "mausoleum" derives from the Mausoleum of Maussollos, the grave for King Maussollos of the Achaemenid Empire of Persia, who ruled Caria.
The English word "mausoleum" derives from the Mausoleum of Maussollos, the grave for King Maussollos of the Achaemenid Empire of Persia, who ruled Caria.
The English word "mausoleum" derives from the Mausoleum of Maussollos, the grave for King Maussollos of the Achaemenid Empire of Persia, who ruled Caria.

sen.j: その大きな墓は世界の七不思議のうちの1つである。
sen.e: His large tomb is one of the Seven Wonders of the World.
His large tomb is one of the Seven Wonders of the World.
His large tomb is one of the Seven Wonders of the World.

sen.j: ニューヨークにあるwGrants Tombはマウソロス霊廟を参考に作られた。
sen.e: The Grant's Tomb in New York was designed based on the Mausoleum of Maussollos.
sen.cmt: 「wGrants Tomb」は「Grant's Tomb」のタイポと思われます。
sen.e: Grant's Tomb in New York was designed based on the Mausoleum of Maussollos.

sen.j: 他には、スプリングフィールド (イリノイ州)のエイブラハム・リンカーンの墓などが有名である。
sen.e: Other notable mausoleums include Abraham LINCOLN's tomb in Springfield (Illinois).
Other notable mausoleums include Abraham LINCOLN's tomb in Springfield, Illinois.
Other notable mausoleums include Abraham LINCOLN's tomb in Springfield, Illinois.

sen.j: 聖人などを祀るところがヨーロッパに多い。
sen.e: In Europe, there are many mausoleum sacred to the saints.
In Europe there are many mausoleums dedicated to the saints.
In Europe there are many mausoleums dedicated to the saints.

sen.j: かつての社会主義諸国では、建国の父を生前の姿そのままに永久保存する形の廟がしばしば作られた。
sen.e: In former socialism countries, mausoleums were often created to preserve the bodies of the founders of countries, with the way they looked when they were alive.
In formerly socialist countries, mausoleums were often created to preserve the bodies of the founders of their countries, with the way they looked when they were alive.
In formerly socialist countries, mausoleums were often created to preserve the bodies of the founders of their countries, with the way they looked when they were alive.

sen.j: その多くは今日でも見ることが出来る。
sen.e: Many of them still exist now.
Many of them still exist today.
Many of them still exist today.

sen.j: モスクワの「レーニン廟」、北京の「毛主席紀念堂」（毛沢東）、ハノイの「ホー・チ・ミン廟」、平壌の「錦繍山記念宮殿」（金日成）など。
sen.e: These include "Lenin's Mausoleum" in Moscow, "Chairman Mao Memorial Hall" (Zedong MAO) in Beijing, the "Ho Chi Minh Mausoleum "in Hanoi, "Kumsusan Memorial Palace" (Il-Sung KIM) in Pyongyang, etc.

sen.j: このような現象に関しては、本来あるべき社会主義の理念からの逸脱として非難されることがある。
sen.e: These phenomena are sometimes criticized as a deviation from the original doctrine of socialism.
